title: error running cron.php, memory leak on getid3.lib.php
body:
hi,

running:

    php -f /var/www/owncloud/cron.php

die after several minutes:

    php fatal error:  allowed memory size of 268435456 bytes exhausted (tried to allocate 20 bytes) in /home/www/owncloud/3rdparty/getid3/getid3.lib.php on line 273

it is consuming all the available memory, event with no limits it crashes (2gb).


### expected behaviour
should update whatever it updates.

### actual behaviour
eats all the memory and crashes.

### steps to reproduce
1. run php -f /var/www/owncloud/cron.php
2. wait and cry

### server configuration
operating system: debian wheezy
web server: apache2
database: sqlite
php version: 5.4.4-14+deb7u3
owncloud version: 5.0.9-0

### logs

#### owncloud log (data/owncloud.log)
```
{"app":"php","message":"allowed memory size of 268435456 bytes exhausted (tried to allocate 20 bytes) at \/home\/www\/owncloud\/3rdparty\/getid3\/getid3.lib.php#273","level":4,"time":1374761242}

```

### server content

too many files? don't think so o_o
